key_title: Key to the species of Gratiola

source.author: Barker, W.R.
source.title: Scrophulariaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Barker, W.R. (1999). Scrophulariaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Prostrate, mat-forming herb; leaves 0.2–1.1 cm long; alps and subalps
Erect to procumbent herbs; leaves 0.5–4.5 cm long; lowlands to montane areas
Pedicels 8–26 mm long; sessile glands with globular heads conspicuous on the leaves, bracteoles and sepals; branches, pedicels, bracteoles and sepals usually finely glandular-pubescent when young
Pedicels less than 7 (–12) mm long; sessile glands conspicuous or obscure; indumentum of glandular and eglandular hairs variable
Sessile glands with conspicuous globular heads on the leaves, bracteoles and sepals; sepals and bracteoles finely glandular-pubescent; pedicels 1–2.5 mm long

Sessile glands obscure, evident as hollows on the leaves, bracteoles and sepals; sepals and bracteoles sparsely hairy with eglandular hairs and/or finely glandular-pubescent to glabrous; pedicels 0.5–8 (–12) mm long
Leaves ovate to somewhat elliptic or broadly so, usually 6–27 mm wide; style (on young capsules) 1.8–3.5 mm long; corolla pink, white in parts
Leaves narrow-ovate to narrow-elliptic, 1–8 mm wide; style (on young capsules) usually 1.3–1.8 mm long; corolla white
